page.title: 01CLUTTON TODAY
page.content: Life in {CLUTTON }today is very different to that in the days of { {William the Conqueror}.There were no council houses then, no school and no cars or lorries. Life is now much easier than 900 years ago. We have a school, a church, a methodist church, a village hall, a playing field and lots more besides.We have a lot of lorries coming through{CLUTTON }as well as cars and some buses. There are several clubs in {CLUTTON}.They include The Old Nick Theatre Group, the Youth Club, the Womens' Institute and the Cubs, Scouts, Guides and Brownies. Last year we came second in the Best Kept Village Competition and all 1450 of us are trying to win it this year. We have included in this project interesting facts about {CLUTTON},everyday life, peoples' jobs and the School.
